articles.title: Create Your Personal Website
articles.description: Welcome to the BEACON 2022 workshop website!
articles.contents:
Contents
Introduction
Preparations for the
workshop


Introduction
Having your own website is like having a digital scientific ‚Äòbusiness
card.‚Äô Perhaps you do not know where to start, or perhaps you started
but then got stuck? In this workshop, you will create your very own
website using R Markdown
and Distill. No
previous programming skills are required; you will start with a
template, and then, step-by-step, add to this website template to
represent you, your science, your teaching, your outreach activities,
etc. You will also learn how and where to host your website. This
website is a simple example of how your own website in Distill could look
like!
Preparations for the
workshop
For the workshop, there are some simple
prerequisites. Please make sure all the following points are
ready on your laptop before you come to the
workshop.
Install
R and RStudio
Install the the following packages in RStudio:


install.packages(c("distill", "rmarkdown", "postcards"))



Create a GitHub account
Install GitHub
Desktop
On the day of the workshop, bring your laptop and
any material you want on your website (photo, text
about you, your project analyses in R, instructions for
making bagels etc..).
If you have any trouble with the preparations, please send Gayoung an email!

articles.title: Instructions
articles.description: Here are some recaps of the workshop on how to set up your website in R Markdown and GitHub.
articles.contents:
Contents
Setting Up
Additional
Links

Setting Up


Version 1
Creating the
website template on your computer
In RStudio, make sure the following packages are loaded by running
the following codes:


library(distill)
library(rmarkdown)




The most common errors are solved by reinstalling R and RStudio, or
updating R. Maybe you need to install the newest version of the
packages! Otherwise, google üòÑ
Make a new R Project by clicking on the New Project
button. 
Click on New Directory, than select Distill
Website from the list.
Give your Website a directory name (a.k.a. name the folder), the
title of your website (can be changed later) and check the box to
configure for Github Pages! Now you have created a basic
template. Make sure to save your .Rmd (R Markdown) files and
render_site(), so that your .Rmd will be made into
.html.
Instead of render_site(), you can also click on
üî® Build
Website.

Uploading your website on
GitHub
Your website template is there, but no one see it yet, because it is
not ‚Äúin the cloud‚Äù. For this, we will use GitHub Pages.
Go to GitHub and create a new repository. You can click
on the plus button on the top right corner.
Give your new repository a name, add a README file and .gitignore
like shown in the screenshot below. Then create! 
Go to the Settings of your repository, click on
Pages and change the Branch to the docs
folder and save.This tells GitHub where to find your .html files. 
In your GitHub Desktop, clone
your new repository onto your laptop.
Move all the contents of your basic template website
into the cloned folder!
Make sure you don‚Äôt copy the folder but only the contents, also the
hidden ones!

In your GitHub Desktop, commit
and push!
Congratulations, you have made your website! ‚ú®


Version 2
A second, more elegant version of creating a website in
GitHub, without having to copy your website template into the repo. This
way will allow you to create an R Project directly inside your
repository.
Create a new repository in GitHub, configure it for GitHub Pages
in the setting and clone it onto your laptop.
The instructions are in Setting up (version 1).

Open RStudio and create a new project, however, this time click
the option Existing Directory, as shown in the
screenshot below.  Make sure to set your Project Working
Directory to the cloned repository folder on your
laptop!
Now you will have a blank R Project with no Distill Website
Template, but don‚Äôt fret! Just type the following line into the console,
then enter your website title! Now you have a website template. Make
sure to save and render_site().


distill::create_website(dir = getwd(), gh_pages = TRUE)



Now the only thing left is to commit
and push your changes in GitHub Desktop.
Congratulations! You have made your website. ‚ú®


Additional Links
Now the only thing left is to personalize your website and to add
content! Please check out the official Distill
website for great step-by-step instructions on how to build the
site. Please check out the tutorial from the Distillery
on how to make an about me page. If you want to understand more
of R Markdown, we recommend this webinar from Alison Hill and Desir√©e De
Leon.
